com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.plan

Class PodInstanceRequirement

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.plan.PodInstanceRequirement

  • public class PodInstanceRequirement
extends java.lang.Object
    A PodInstanceRequirement encapsulates a PodInstance and the names of tasks that should be launched in it.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static PodInstanceRequirement create(PodInstance podInstance, java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> tasksToLaunch)
      Creates a new instance which isn't marked as a permanent replacement.
      static PodInstanceRequirement create(PodInstance podInstance, java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> tasksToLaunch, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> environment)
      Creates a new instance with each task's environment extended by the provided envvar name-to-value map that is not a permanent replacement.
      static PodInstanceRequirement createPermanentReplacement(PodInstance podInstance, java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> tasksToLaunch)
      Creates a new instance which is marked as a permanent replacement.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getEnvironment()
      Returns the map of environment variable names to values that extend the existing environments of tasks in this pod.
      PodInstance getPodInstance()
      Returns the definition of the pod instance to be created.
      java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getTasksToLaunch()
      Returns the list of tasks to be launched within this pod.
      boolean isPermanentReplacement()
      Returns whether this pod is replacing a previous instance that failed permanently.
      PodInstanceRequirement withParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
      Returns this same instance, but with the supplied environment variable map applied to each task in this pod.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static PodInstanceRequirement create(PodInstance podInstance,
                                            java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> tasksToLaunch)
        Creates a new instance which isn't marked as a permanent replacement.

      • create

        public static PodInstanceRequirement create(PodInstance podInstance,
                                            java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> tasksToLaunch,
                                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> environment)
        Creates a new instance with each task's environment extended by the provided envvar name-to-value map that is not a permanent replacement.

      • createPermanentReplacement

        public static PodInstanceRequirement createPermanentReplacement(PodInstance podInstance,
                                                                java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> tasksToLaunch)
        Creates a new instance which is marked as a permanent replacement.

      • withParameters

        public PodInstanceRequirement withParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        Returns this same instance, but with the supplied environment variable map applied to each task in this pod.

      • getPodInstance

        public PodInstance getPodInstance()
        Returns the definition of the pod instance to be created.

      • getTasksToLaunch

        public java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getTasksToLaunch()
        Returns the list of tasks to be launched within this pod. This doesn't necessarily match the tasks listed in the PodInstance.

      • getEnvironment

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getEnvironment()
        Returns the map of environment variable names to values that extend the existing environments of tasks in this pod.

      • isPermanentReplacement

        public boolean isPermanentReplacement()
        Returns whether this pod is replacing a previous instance that failed permanently. In this case new resources should be created, even though (now failed) TaskInfos are still present in the StateStore.
